summary: This document is a chain of emails from May 2019 regarding travel approval requests for federal prosecutors to conduct victim interviews in West Palm Beach, Florida, as part of the investigation for United States v. Epstein. It details flight and hotel logistics, coordination issues, and references the case as relating to the enticement of minors for sexual activity.

connections.description: Co-requesters for travel approval to conduct victim interviews in Florida for the Epstein investigation, indicating they work together as prosecutors.

events.title: Travel for victim interviews in West Palm Beach
events.description: Prosecutors travel to West Palm Beach, Florida, to conduct interviews with victims as part of the Epstein investigation. They book flights and a hotel for this purpose.

events.title: Initial travel approval request for Epstein investigation
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorneys S and IM request permission to travel to Florida for meetings and interviews related to United States v. Epstein.

events.title: Follow-up travel approval request
events.description: S requests permission to travel to West Palm Beach for approximately three days for meetings and interviews in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: The document references the criminal case 'United States v. Epstein, 2018R01618', described as 'an investigation relating to enticement of minors for sexual activity'.
Federal prosecutors from the Southern District of New York were actively traveling to Florida in May 2019 to conduct interviews with victims as part of the Epstein investigation.
Travel logistics show coordination for interviews in West Palm Beach, with prosecutors potentially flying from New York to Florida and then directly to San Francisco for personal travel.
The email chain indicates ongoing investigative activity and victim engagement by the U.S. Attorney's Office several months before Epstein's arrest in July 2019.
Multiple travel approval requests in March, April, and May 2019 suggest sustained investigative efforts in Florida during that period.
